jparsec.io.image

Class ImageHeaderElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.image.ImageHeaderElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ImageHeaderElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to manage image headers.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • key

        public java.lang.String key
        Holds the key.

      • value

        public java.lang.String value
        Holds the value.

      • comment

        public java.lang.String comment
        Holds a comment. Used in fits file.

      • format

        public java.lang.String format
        Holds a format specification, usually not needed (at least in fits files). Possible values are:

        A - String.
        J - Integer.
        D - Double.
        F - Float.
        L - Boolean.
        I - Short.
        C - Complex float.
        M - Complex double.
        X - Byte.
        B - Byte.

        value - The value.
        comment - The comment.

    • Method Detail

      • parseHeader

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] parseHeader(java.lang.String[] columns)
        Parses a given set of columns to produce a header.
        Parameters:
        columns - Columns with key + space + value + space(s) + / + comment. Comment is optional.
        Returns:
        The header.

      • getHeader

        public static java.lang.String[] getHeader(ImageHeaderElement[] header)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Returns the header array for an image.
        Parameters:
        header - The header set of objects.
        Returns:
        The header array.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getIndex

        public static int getIndex(ImageHeaderElement[] header,
           java.lang.String key,
           boolean considerCase)
        Returns the index of a given key.
        Parameters:
        header - The header.
        key - The key to search.
        considerCase - True to match case (exactly the input key).
        Returns:
        The index of the key, or -1 if it is not found.

      • getByDescription

        public static ImageHeaderElement getByDescription(ImageHeaderElement[] param,
                                  java.lang.String d)
        Searches for a given ImageHeaderElement by its description.
        Parameters:
        param - The array of ImageHeaderElement.
        d - The description to search for.
        Returns:
        The ImageHeaderElement found, or null if there's no any.

        public static ImageHeaderElement getByKey(ImageHeaderElement[] param,
                          java.lang.String d)
        Searches for a given ImageHeaderElement by its key.
        Parameters:
        param - The array of ImageHeaderElement.
        d - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        The ImageHeaderElement found, or null if there's no any.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(ImageHeaderElement[] input)
        Returns a string representation of an array of headers.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The String.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(ImageHeaderElement[] header,
                        int l1,
                        int l2)
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Returns the header array for a .fits image.
        Parameters:
        header - The header set of objects.
        l1 - Length of column 1 (key name), 25 recommended.
        l2 - Length of column 2 (value), 10 recommended.
        Returns:
        The header array.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getFitsHeader

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] getFitsHeader(java.lang.Object o)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Constructs a simple header for a fits file using the dimensions and type supplied from the input data. Cards inserted are BITPIX, NAXIS, NAXIS1, NAXIS2, and EXTEND (set a T = true to allow extensions).
        Parameters:
        o - The data as an array with 2 dimensions, type double, int, float, short, or byte.
        Returns:
        The basic header.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the format of the input data is not recognized.

      • addHeaderEntry

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] addHeaderEntry(ImageHeaderElement[] input,
                                  ImageHeaderElement entry)
        Adds a specific entry to a header defined by a set of ImageHeaderElement objects.
        Parameters:
        input - Input header.
        entry - Entry to add. If it is already present, it will be updated.
        Returns:
        The new header.

      • deleteHeaderEntries

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] deleteHeaderEntries(ImageHeaderElement[] input,
                                       java.lang.String[] keys)
        Deletes a set of entries from a header defined by a set of ImageHeaderElement objects.
        Parameters:
        input - Input header.
        keys - Entries to remove if it is present.
        Returns:
        The new header.

      • deleteHeaderEntry

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] deleteHeaderEntry(ImageHeaderElement[] input,
                                     java.lang.String key)
        Deletes a specific entry to a header defined by a set of ImageHeaderElement objects.
        Parameters:
        input - Input header.
        key - Entry to remove if it is present.
        Returns:
        The new header.

      • addHeaderEntry

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] addHeaderEntry(ImageHeaderElement[] input,
                                  ImageHeaderElement[] entries)
        Adds some entries to a header defined by a set of ImageHeaderElement objects.
        Parameters:
        input - Input header.
        entries - Entries to add. Any of them already present in the input header will be updated.
        Returns:
        The new header.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(ImageHeaderElement[] input,
               java.lang.String key)
        Checks if a header contains a card or not.
        Parameters:
        input - Input header.
        key - The card to check.
        Returns:
        True if the header contains an entry with the given key, false otherwise.

      • getIndex

        public static int getIndex(ImageHeaderElement[] input,
           java.lang.String key)
        Checks if a header contains a card or not, returning the index position of it.
        Parameters:
        input - Input header.
        key - The card to check.
        Returns:
        The index, or -1 if it is not found.
